alert.note: Alert for St. Croix (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 19 at 5:16PM CDT by NWS Minneapolis
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Pierce and south central St. Croix Counties through 545 PM CDT... At 516 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Prescott, or 7 miles southwest of River Falls, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... River Falls and Ellsworth around 525 PM CDT. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CDT for southeastern Minnesota. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CDT for east central Minnesota...and west central Wisconsin.
